name: 2D fingerprints
description: Binary representation of the 2D structure of a molecule. The neighborhood of every atom is encoded using circular topology hashing.

name: 3D fingerprints
description: The 3D structures of the three best conformers after energy minimization are hashed into a binary representation without the need for structural alignment.

name: Scaffolds
description: Largest molecular scaffold (usually a ring system) remaining after applying Murcko's pruning rules. Additionally, we keep the corresponding framework, i.e. a version of the scaffold where all atoms are carbons and all bonds are single. The scaffold and the framework are encoded with path-based 1024-bit fingerprints, suitable for capturing substructures in similarity searches.

name: Structural keys
description: 166 functional groups and substructures widely accepted by medicinal chemists (MACCS keys).

name: Physicochemistry
description: Physicochemical properties such as molecular weight, logP and refractivity. Number of hydrogen-bond donors and acceptors, rings, etc. Drug-likeness measurements e.g. number of structural alerts, Lipinski's rule-of-5 violations or chemical beauty (QED).

name: Mechanism of action
technical_name: Targets with a known therapeutic effect
description: Drug targets with known pharmacological action and modes (agonist, antagonist, etc.).

name: Metabolic genes
technical_name: Drug metabolizing enzymes, transporters and carriers
description: Drug metabolizing enzymes, transporters and carriers.

name: Crystals
technical_name: Compound-protein co-crystals encoded with ECOD domains
description: Small molecules co-crystalized with protein chains. Data is organized according to the structural families of the protein chains.

name: Binding
technical_name: Physical binding data extracted mainly from the literature
description: Compound-protein binding data available in major public chemogenomics databases. Data mainly comes from academic publications and patents. Only binding affinities below a class-specific threshold are kept (kinases: 30 nM, GPCRs: 100 nM, nuclear receptors: 100 nM, ion channels: 10 uM and others: 1 uM).

name: HTS bioassays
technical_name: Compound-protein interaction data, including functional assays, mainly extracted from HTS bioassays
description: Hits from screening campaigns against protein targets (mainly confirmatory functional assays below 10 uM).

name: Small molecule roles
description: Ontology terms associated to small molecules with recognized biological roles, such as known drugs, metabolites and other natural products.

name: Small molecule pathways
technical_name: Metabolic pathways from the human reconstruction of metabolism (Recon)
description: Curated reconstruction of human metabolism, containing metabolites and reactions. Data is represented as a network where nodes are metabolites and edges connect substrates and products of reactions.

name: Signaling pathways
description: Canonical pathways related to the known receptors of compounds (as recorded in B4.001). Pathways are assigned via a guilt-by-association approach, i.e. a molecule is related to a pathway if at least one of the molecule targets is a member of it.

name: Biological processes
technical_name: GO biological processes of the targets
description: Similar to C3.001, biological processes from the gene ontology are associated to compounds via a guilt-by-association approach from B4.001 data. All parent terms are kept, from the 'leaves' of the ontology to its 'root'.

name: Interactome
technical_name: Proteins in the PPI neighborhood of the targets
description: Neighborhoods of B4.001 targets are collected by inspecting several large protein-protein interaction networks. A random-walk algorithm is used to obtain a robust measure of proximity in the network.

name: Gene expression
description: Transcriptional response of cell lines upon exposure to small molecules. A well-documented reference dataset of gene expression profiles is used to map all compound profiles using a two-sided gene set enrichment analysis.

name: Cancer cell lines
description: Small molecule sensitivity data (GI50) of a panel of 60 cancer cell lines.

name: Chemical genetics
technical_name: Chemical genetics profiling extracted from the MOSAIC database; the inferred targets are used.
description: Growth inhibition profiles in a panel of aka 300 yeast mutants. Data are combined with yeast genetic interaction data, so that compounds can be assimilated to genetic alterations when they have similar profiles.

name: Morphology
technical_name: 812 morphological features from the LINCS consortium
description: Changes in U-2 OS cell morphology measured after compound treatment using a multiplexed-cytological 'cell painting' assay. 812 morphology features are recorded via automated microscopy and image analysis.

name: Cell bioassays
technical_name: Growth inhibition (and similar) assays from the literature
description: Small molecule cell bioassays reported in ChEMBL, mainly growth and proliferation measurements found in the literature.

name: Therapeutic areas
description: Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) codes of drugs. All ATC levels are considered.

name: Indications
description: Indications of approved drugs and drugs in clinical trials. A controlled medical vocabulary is used.

name: Side effects
technical_name: Drug side effects reported in package inserts (SIDER)
description: Side effects extracted from drug package inserts via text-mining techniques.

name: Diseases and toxicology
description: Manually curated relationships between chemicals and diseases. Chemicals include drug molecules and environmental substances, among others.

name: Drug-drug interactions
description: Changes in the effect of a drug when it is taken together with a second drug. Drug-drug interactions may alter pharmacokinetics and/or cause side effects.
